content:
DbLambda Class

Definition

Represents a Lambda function that can be invoked to produce a DbLambdaExpression.

In this Article

public sealed class DbLambda
Inheritance
System.Object
DbLambda

Inherited Members

Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

No content here will be updated; please do not add material here.

Properties

Body

Gets the body of the lambda expression.

public System.Data.Common.CommandTrees.DbExpression Body { get; }
Value
DbExpression

A DbExpression that represents the body of the lambda function.

Variables

Gets the parameters of the lambda expression.

public System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Data.Common.CommandTrees.DbVariableReferenceExpression> Variables { get; }
Value
IList<DbVariableReferenceExpression>

The list of lambda function parameters represented as DbVariableReferenceExpression objects.

Methods

Create(DbExpression,IEnumerable<DbVariableReferenceExpression>)

Creates a DbLambda with the specified inline Lambda function implementation and formal parameters.

public static System.Data.Common.CommandTrees.DbLambda Create (System.Data.Common.CommandTrees.DbExpression body, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Data.Common.CommandTrees.DbVariableReferenceExpression> variables);
body
DbExpression

An expression that defines the logic of the Lambda function

variables
IEnumerable<DbVariableReferenceExpression>

A DbVariableReferenceExpression collection that represents the formal parameters to the Lambda function. These variables are valid for use in the body expression.

Returns
DbLambda

A new DbLambda that describes an inline Lambda function with the specified body and formal parameters

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

ArgumentException

variables
